meanings.sent1: The old car was grimier than the new one.
meanings.sent2: After playing outside, the children returned home with grimier clothes.
meanings.sent3: The dog's paws left grimier prints on the clean floor.
meanings.sent4: Her mood grew grimier as the day went on.
meanings.sent5: The kitchen sink was so grimier that it looked almost black.

meanings.definition: More dirty or filthy than something else
meanings.sent1: The alley behind the restaurant was even grimier than the street.
meanings.sent2: The public restroom was grimier than she had ever seen before.
meanings.sent3: The joke got grimier as it went on, making everyone laugh harder.
meanings.sent4: His secrets were hidden in the grimier corners of his mind.
meanings.sent5: The water in the pond looked grimier after the storm passed.
